oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Stage Coach of General Andrew Jackson, between 1930 and 1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Stage Coach of General Andrew Jackson, Seventh President of the United States. The vehicle is pictured next to the old Smoke House at The Hermitage, home of President Jackson, located 12 miles east of downtown Nashville. The Jackson family carriage was a horse-drawn vehicle that was purchased while Jackson was president. The trip from the Hermitage into Nashville would have taken approximately an hour and a half. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
